# The RPS Konami Code
Chances are - this code won't create a god-bot that destroys this meta-meta we have created, but it is a string worth noting.
source.61e83775:
# The Evolutionary Process
This code was created by a simple evolutionary algorithm that created a population of 1000 Move lists. Each with a random string of 1000 moves (Rock : 0, Paper : 1, Scissors : 2). Each move list was judged based on the amount of rounds won in a 12 round bout with a Simple Markov Chain agent. This agent was my most sucessful at the time - therefore I saw it best fit we use this as our basis of success. Once each agent in the population was judged, the bottom half of the population was replaced by children from the top half of the population. Each child is mutated slightly and the process is repeated until a move list that wins all 12 rounds is found. These mutations were more likely to occur at the end of the move list rather than the beginning. This is because the beginning half of these matches seem to be more about exploring your opponent's capabilities rather than trying to win each move.
source.fd5d9d47:
# Reflection
Overall - This approach has taken a good amount in computational resources to process, but the outcome is very interesting. I have a hunch that although this method will not get you to the top of the leaderboard, it can open up an area of research for match-play analysis that would allow for even smarter agents. Perhaps each move list the top 100 play explores more patterns. Furthermore, it is worth nothing that theoretically the move list below could be rotated and have similar results.
